result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed. Any remaining amount due to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with the victim without the approval of the court or the probation agent.
3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation as approved by the probation agent.

Attend and successfully complete an Anger Management program.
Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment. Absolute Sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin Michael Lovejoy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $918.00 entered as ordered by the court on 12/17/15 to pay $60.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 04/18/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed.  Copy mailed to defendant.
Corrected to fix a clerical error on length of probation.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Aidaliz R., defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6  MONTHS in the House of Correction; credit for  2  days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  12  MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered  30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Management program
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court or the probation agent
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation as approved by the probation agent
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Any remaining amount due to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 03-11-2016

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 11-2-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 11-18-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Agreed Upon Request for New date signed by all parties and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court appoints Attorney Jospeh Domask, who was present and agreed to accepting the case.  Court orders Attorney Domask to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-20-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM030951  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/24/2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with : Aidaliz R or her children.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Quentin Michael Lovejoy in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT  MAY OR MAY NOT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION BASED UPON HIS EMPLOYMENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
